reviews.review: Oh Yeah!!! HEAVY METAL !!

Killing Floor est un de ces jeux de zombies qui s'en sort très bien.

- Durée de vie : Monstrueuse, beaucoup de compétences à maxer, beaucoup de maps réparties sur deux modes de jeu (le classique : les zombies arrivent par vagues, et un mode objectif où l'on doit compléter différents objectifs pour avancer dans la map).
Et surtout beaucoup de succès ! Il y aussi 5 modes de difficulté dont les derniers donneront du fil à retordre aux plus aguerris.

- Gameplay : accrocheur, pleins d'armes pour une grande diversité, le seul reproche est au niveau du corps à corps qui est difficile à prendre en main au début contrairement aux phases de shoot.

- Graphismes : un peu ternes et vieillot c'est vrai mais n'oublions pas que c'est l'Unreal Engine 2 modifié ! D'ailleurs les dernières maps compensent ce jeu de couleurs ternes pour une petite refonte graphique à chaque fois.

- Scénario : Il faut le reconnaître, on pense qu'on est lâché sans scénario mais il suffit de jouer en mode objectif ou de lire les descriptions de map pour comprendre ;)

- Jouabilité : Tout seul ou jusqu'à 6 par map, vous pouvez vous amuser sans modération !

En bref, une bonne alternative au très connu Left 4 Dead, en plus il peut même tourner sur une vieille bécane !

KillingFloor is by far the best Zombie survival game I have played, and I've played a few others such as LFD, LFD:2, Zombie panic source, Zmod on CSS, COD:zombies, and more. I STILL feel this game is AWESOME after such a long time that I have been playing it, it just never gets old, I think what makes it one of my favs is the gun recoil animations, makes me feel as if I really was shooting around. lots of weapons and it's just a unique game as well with a world full of different maps.
Dareeeeee !!
Игра просто афигенная всем советую )

If you like a zombie killing FPS then BUY this. It's not storyline like L4D or L4D2. It's round based with a boss on the last round. At the end of each round you buy guns/ammo. There are 6 different roles called perks, Medic, Support, Sharpshooter, Berserker, Firebug, and Commando. Each perk gets different weapon upgrades and performs a specific task in a team up to 6 people. Alot of people do whatever until the late rounds when the fleshpounder comes out then suddenly its a group effort.

I was considering giving this a negative rating, but in the end went for positive. You'll find out why at the end of this review.

There is a large selection of weapons, which is for some ridiculously rare regarding zombie games. However, you will likely never use most of those guns as you will quickly find out which ones are the best and then only use those. There are multiple classes to choose from, and leveling them up gives some motivation to continue, but with the improvements being nearly all percentage boosts, it just seems lazy and kind of pointless. There are multiple difficulty levels, but they feel more like they were designed to be played as your class level increased as opposed to actually wanting a different level of difficulty. Plenty of characters to choose from, but only the paid DLC characters are different in any way other than textures. There are multiple enemy types, but they all seem like lazy grab-bag stereotypes (Fat exploder, invisible, slightly stronger than normal red guy, really big guy.) The only one that seems creative in any way is the siren, which messes up your aim. The modding community is pretty good though, and bad mods can't be counted against the game.

As you can see, nearly every positive part of the game also has downsides. So how could this be rated positive while there are still negative aspects to cover? Well, the game is fun in multiplayer. Get a few friends together and you can have fun for hours. Even playing with random people isn't that bad.

Now, for the completely negative... The DLC. There is tons of DLC, and nearly all of it is useless. You're probably now thinking "Well, I just won't buy it." The developers thought of that too. When starting a game, a painfully loud advertisement for the new DLC will play. Aside from horrible bussiness tactics, the voice acting is terrible and the wait time for starting a new round is a minute of constant boredom. 

I would still recommend getting this game. You will probably want to wait for a sale, and make sure you have friends.

Достоинства: Отличный магазин, акций, а также синхронизация.
Недостатки: Если вы любитель графики, она не для вас.
Играя Killing Floor вы погружаетесь в атмосферу, зайдя на пару минут, вы выйдете максимум только через пару часов, так как если играя один, ты получаешь много положительных эмоций, а если играть с друзьями то в два раза больше! Скримеры, а если так, то внезапные моменты, которые бывают частенько, делают эту игру лучше других в этом стиле! Большой выбор холодного и огнестрельного оружия даёт шанс вам повеселиться от души! Резать, стрелять, взрывать, чинить и лечить только в этой игре! Огромный плюс в том, что часто выходят обновления!

Lacking in the graphics department, but it's only gotten better over time. it's a must play.

Value for money: 11/11 -Worth every penny (11/10 is not a true rating that anyone should ever use)

Questo titolo è uno di quei classici che si era promesso bene, ma si è rivelato una delusione. Nato come mod per Unreal Tournament 2004 e in seguito rifatto nel 2009. In 6 - 7 anni non hanno cambiato/migliorato niente di questo titolo. Fra pregi e difetti credo che avrà pù difetti che pregi.

Pregi:
- Grafica leggera
- Armamentario vasto
- Bestiario vario
- Il rallenty
- Tanti livelli

Difetti:
- L'audio e i suoni sono gestiti male. Questo vuol dire che quando senti i mostri fare i loro classici versi non sai mai dove provengano
- Non puoi fare una partita privata con gli amici almeno che non tu affitti un server
- Non puoi creare stanze 
- Il rallenty. Sì lo cito anche frai i difetti il rallenty perchè quando fai un'esecuzione il rallenty lo vedano anche i tuoi amici e da fastidio
- La torcia si può avere solo se tieni la pistola Berretta e in tutte le altri armi no
- Ci sono troppi DLC inutili con skin, armi tamarre e altra robe che non servono a niente se non a rendere il tuo pg più figo e diverso dai modelli default
- Esiste il workshop ma gran parte delle mod non funzionano
- Le musiche. In particolare quella fastidiosa musichetta nel menù principale che ho provato a cambiare con qualche mod nello workshop
- Grafica datata
- Lo spawn dei mostri è completamente a random. Quindi se ti spawnano di dietro non gli vedi e in particolare modo non gli senti (tornando alle questione audio gestito male)

This is my favorite game.  Beats L4D hands down.  The fact that you are faced with waves and how the game focus' on teamplay makes this game far superior.  Unfort... the ut2k4 doesn't take advantage of multi-core, but if you have the gfx and the proc, then it's not a challenge

A good alternative to Left4Dead, rather then having a series of objectives to meet as you progress through a level, this game gives you death-match style maps (literally 100's of them) to survive in over the course of several progressivly harder waves of mutant - Zombie-esque Frankensteins monster creations. Each wave is seperated by a brief downtime period during which players use money earned from kills to buy new weapons.
There is a boss called the Patriarch who shows up in the final round and can be very difficult to beat on the harder game difficulties.
The players character has a number of battle roles called 'perks' (for some inexplicable reason) As the player achieves certain tasks relating to each 'Perk' they will raise that perk in level, as each perk raises in level it will increase the overall strength of your character and eventually (at level 5) will unlock starting bonus's like weapons or armour that you otherwise would not have access to on the first round of play. Players are required to choose a perk before playing a game and also have the option of changing perks after death (During an actual game ie: inbetween rounds while waiting and spectating -like in any other fps ) The choice of perk prior to entering combat will determine which set of specific perk related bonus's you will be using during that game, ie: Commando perk gives you percentage bonus's on using assault and combat rifles whereas a Berserker will get bonus's to melee related combat and movement speed.
This is not Call of duty, If you want that game look elsewhere and also have your I.Q checked because you are probably re-tarded.
Awesome addictive fun with a good gentle learning curve (for those familiar with FPS games)
.
Highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys games like Left4Dead or Counterstrike.

Oh, what to say about this game. Its hard to recomend it outright, because its a shitty game. But its one of those shitty games that keeps dragging you back into it.

Do I recomend it? Yeah, I suppose so. Over 1000 hours I'd better recomend it. Is it for everyone? No, its not. Its kinda of a cult hit. Most people will get it when its on sale, play a few games of it, and then never touch it again. Others will play it for a few hours, and come back in a few months. But everyone that you see playing Killing Floor year round (not during the holiday events) is a true Killing Floor player.

So, pros? Well..
-Its got a great modding community; the workshop, Tripwire Interactive forums, and many other sites host great mods and maps, which add to the game.
-Great players; on the whole, most players are pretty good. There are some aimbotters that get away with it, some rude people, trolls, the usual. But most people tend to be pretty good.
-Modded servers; this is what really gives the game value. Modded servers are the main reason that anyone even plays this game anymore. Without them, this game would be retired.
-Lots of custom weapons, skins, and specimens; keeps the game interesting.

Cons? Yeah, theres a bunch..
-First of all, this game is ancient. Its a mod for Unreal Tournament 2004, using the Unreal 2 engine. So there are some major engine bugs. 
-Crashes; since its an old game and older engine, the game has trouble handling more than 2gb of ram. On modded servers, often the clients will crash because the engine wasn't meant to handle this. Happens on regular servers too.
-Server limitations; dedicated servers have some pretty bad limitations on what you can and can't do. There's a general limit to how many files the server can load at one time, if you exceed that, then the server will hang. 
-The server also hangs if a weapon/mutator gets added that isn't compatible with a certain map or game mode, thus rendering the server unusable until the admin fixes it.
-The voice acting is bad. Like, at first, you're going to think its awful voice acting. 1000 hours later, you want to shoot the voice actors for the obnoxious game speech.
-The DLC weapons are community weapons, reskinned and sold by TWI. The player skins are nothing to write home about.
-Frameloss; the game engine can't adequatly handle the game itself, and even in a regular solo game, your FPS can go from 100 to 5. Online games? Ha, good luck. Try turning off ambient lighting.

-Tripwire doesn't actually fix anything. They push out updates every holiday, maybe a new character skin or map, but thats it. They make intentional changes to break mods and just generally do nothing productive. No fixes to the engine, the gameplay, the menu system, nothing.

What DOES tripwire do, though? Break things. Break all the things. This past winter event, they broke the workshop, so every time you launched the game, Steam would download your workshop content. Again. And again. And again. I had 75GB of temporary files that kept increasing in size. It took Tripwire a month to push out a fix for it. An ever-growing list of things they broke~

The only reason this game is still alive is because of the modding community and the admins of modded servers. They are the ONLY reason this game is still alive, still being played. And even still, there is no point to this game. This is just a wave based survival game, with the same specimens coming at you, the same bad guns, and the same awful voice acting, over and over. 

Killing Floor is nothing without the mods. Killing Floor would be better without Tripwire Interactive. There needs to be a Killing Floor 2, or a Killing Floor HD Edition, with-AT THE VERY LEAST- a new game engine, maybe something from the same decade the game was made in.

An instant zombie classic. This game brought me together with many friends and introduced me to many other awesome gamers who like to kill zombies. Games can range from short - long, lasting 4 waves - 10 waves, with a Patriarch boss getting his own wave at the end. Similar to L4D, except gameplay is wave based not objective based. However there is an objective play mode with a few maps that are fun as well. 

From your basic zombie (referred to as ZEDs in this game) to the intimidating Fleshpound and Scrake, there are many different special zombie types who will all try to eat you in different ways.

There are 7 perk types to play as, from the melee Berserker, to the Medic, to the Sharpshooter, there is likely a class you will really enjoy playing.

Play solo or with a group up to 6, and on custom servers upwards of 30 players on one server.

Many players have created custom maps or objective modes that are unique and fun to play, aside from the 30~ish regular maps, if you like killing zombies, this game can get addicting. 

There are 5 difficulty levels, and starting out you really should play on 1/5 - Beginner, because as you level your perks (which level to 6 ((higher on custom servers))) you will become stronger with those weapon types and gain necessary benefits to damage and survival that you need to have for higher difficulties.

After 700~ hours, I've completed all but a handful of maps on 4/5 diff - Suicidal. It's extremely challenging and 5/5 diff is even more ridiculous. If you're good at FPS you will get the hang of it, but like any game, this one in particular takes time and practice.

A great game to play with friends as well, the more perk types your team can cover the better chances you have of surviving, although it is possible to solo most difficulties with any perk, some are more challenging than others. Each perk has a role that they perform and zombies they should focus on taking out, teamwork is key and if you are a lone wolf you can stick with solo.

Still fun after years of playing it. Up there with L4D.
This is an amazing round based shooter where you try and survive through waves of monsters!

OCENA: 9.5/10

Великолепная идея, вполне сносное исполнение, но это практически все, чем может порадовать Killing Floor. Я поиграл в нее достаточно, и в одиночку и с друзьями. Да, очень интересно выживать, большое количество оружия, множество карт и еще большее количество персонажей. Но все это как-то сыро, скудновато, в конце концов скучно. Единственным плюсом для меня является элемент страха, вот что точно, то в этом кооперативном хорроре действительно местами страшно. Из всех хороших сторон этой игры эта самая хорошая, уж простите за тавтологию. Все остальное уныло и печально. При всех достоинствах, которые отмечает большое количество игроков игра все же заурядная, так как нужно смотреть на вещи реально. Не имею никакого негативного отношения к игре, просто я попытался оценить игру наиболее объективно. Играть в нее можно, и даже нужно, но вот покупать ее и затем тратить на нее огромное количество времени, не советую.

P.S.Уже молчу о графике, но она тут, ну, даже не знаю, стоит сказать "кошмарная графика в игре о кошмарах", не приятная глазу картинка, надеюсь если будет 2 часть исправят, а то уже надоели дополнения с новыми персонажами и всякие "эвенты".
Meiner Meinung nach ein richtig cooles Spiel. Ich kann es nur weiter empfehlen. Besonders für alle die sehr gerne mit Freunden spielen/spielen wollen. Ich kann das Spiel nur loben.

Killing Floor is a game you would maybe pick up in a sale. Y'know, you've got a bit of dosh left over from that one game you've waited to come on sale for a year. Killing Floor - Get together with some friends or some randoms, kill zombies and maybe even kill the Patriarch. Level up some perks and you will feel such a sense of achievement that you dedicated so much time to this. Now that I have possibly got you interested, I shall add my views on the game...

The immersion factor is really good as the game has a rather dark basis and uses moderately graphic themes, but DAMN are they amazing!!! Sometimes you will enter a room and find a scientist who has been torn up just inches from an alarm, leaving you to imagine what had happened. Perhaps there will be a soldier, surrounded in shell casings from the gun now lying beside him which he had used to make his valiant last stand this game can tell a whole range of stories without even using words or text. The graphics are stunning and have very low requirements to be played at optimal capacity. There are a great range of enemies and the game spawns them well so you aren't constantly battling the same enemy. There is an excellent variation between classes in order to match everyones play style. Of course the weapons are a key feature in this game and my oh my, what is this, a chainsaw? Don't mind if I do, a crossbow? Well cheers, and a whole lot more, honestly, if you want it, this game probably has it. If it doesn't then it will probably have some well priced DLC to satisfy you... The game features brilliant voice acting and a nice amount of stock playable characters. There are DLC characters aswell, from everything to a Cyborg Chicken to your average Chav, both stock and DLC characters have unique and comedic backstories too. The game makes the apocalypse a gleeful place for all, except the wave upon wave of cretins you bruttally murder by any means. The game makes use of both blatant and subtle comedy, making it hilarious when you are treated to some good old English stereotyping for dialogue. The game supports Steam workshop and also has an active community that submit ideas for DLC's! Forget bang for your buck, this game gives you BOOM! POW! SMACK! all for an amazing price. Is this game worth the money, money, money? HELL YEAH!!! This game gets 11/10 from me and my friends and I hope you have an equally epic experience. Final Comments - BUY THIS GAME NOW!!!

I would definitely give it an 8/10, it may not be origional, but it is just amazing in it's own form. Especially with the british accents :D

A must own if you enjoy zombie like creatures and shooters, this game may have started out as a MOD for another game, but it was developed into a wonderful thing.

One of the single best games out there. It really is just one of the best. It's a round base game with a lot of variation. It mixes up the gameplay a lot, and it varies per class. It's got some decent challenge to it as well, while it can be kind of unfair at times. Although it's got some flays like you have to switch to your blade to sprint, it's still a lot of fun. 

10/10 would bang.
If this game ever comes out with a sequel I will dedicate the rest of my life figuring out how to mate with a video game.

UW07M8/10

Easly one of the best zombie survival games you can find. Very simple concept but the gameplay and multiplayer is just great.

But,
-I dont like so much that all the zombies from one type look alike. There should be some variety inside each type so they dont look like clones.
-Also, there are a lot of weapons, but once you know them all you wish there was more.
-Some additional gamemodes would be great.
-And for gods sake, pleae fix the "Machete"! It looks like a ridiclulous knife.

Killing floor is an outstanding survival game that has to be played with friends.  9/10
A incredibly fun zombie/survival game with a good focus on teamwork and cooperation, something not seen in many games these days. 8/10 GabeN points.

A very repetative and clunky fps, there's not much option for maps, and the objectives are all the same. There's nothing in this game that stands out, nothing to make it worth playing, much less buying, no matter how cheap.
